title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a single interview conducted via Teams involving myself and four potential colleagues. The team was friendly and eager to listen and asked questions regarding my experience and goals for pursuing the role.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with regulatory work for clinical research?

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed onsite with the supervisor who posted the job and also with the department head. I was asked questions about past work experiences related to databases and data management.
Interview Questions: What statistical programs have you used?

title: Junior Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for an Interview over Skype with 2 nice people and then told I would be contacted further if I got the position between me and a few other candidates.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strengths?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was schedule fast and was set up by email. The interviewer repeated some questions based on my past experience to see if I was a good fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Talk a little bit more about your experience in qualitative research..

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, just want to see if you have the technical skills to work basic data applications. Excel, sql, tableau etc. Pretty relaxed interview. Will probably interview a couple different times with a couple different people.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with SQL?

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: The social media manager role had 2 interview stages when I applied in 2020. The first interview was a phone screen. The second was with the team to see if you would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experiences.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: they ask us why phd, why have much RA experience, why cancer biology, talk about now decisions and future plan for the PhD. at last, question for Pittsburgh. I come from africa, so maybe this is a big disadvantages
Interview Questions: they ask us why phd, why have much RA experience, why cancer biology, talk about now decisions and future plan for the PhD.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening interview, followed by a video interview on Zoom, was then asked to submit 2 existing writing samples and to do a short project that they assigned. The final interview was with the Director and Associate Director.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe a project you were on where you faced an obstacle and how you overcame that.

title: Business Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pleasant and effective. I did a phone screening, then a zoom interview with three people from the university. I received an offer a few days later. The HR representatives were extremely helpful in answering any questions I had and liaising between myself and the department offering me employment.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict? Describe a time when you had to deal with many tasks. What is your workplace temperament?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy and the process was very smooth and documentation was easiest. The HR are really good and they guide you through your interview process and hiring process.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from this job?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Complete online app using internal system Phone interview usually lasting 10-15 min On campus interview lasting 1 day. Phone interview questions vary but expect to answer why Pitt Greensburg and not university of Pittsburgh in Oakland (main campus). Also might be asked about our mission statement so review.
Interview Questions: Why Pitt Greensburg? How I will follow the mission of the college?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: In person and phone call.  After you apply, a week or so later they’ll call you to discuss the position. In person they ask you specific skill sets. After this they review and will call you back whether or not you get the job.
Interview Questions: What motivates you the most ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Directly applied on university HR and had a reply within a week for a descriptive and stress free interview. Talk job description, my background, questions, they asked a few and we were done!
Interview Questions: Where do you see your career going in the future?

title: Financial Account Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and recruiter mailed me for a short zoom interview. Later 2 rounds of interview, first round is behavioral questions and second round is with 2 hiring managers for 1.5 hour.
Interview Questions:
20 mins exam consisting of four questions about budgeting. Later interview with 2 hiring managers asked General questions.
Introduce yourself?
How previous experience relate to current position?
Challenges faced in previous role?
Outside interests?
What do you know about Pitt university?
Rate yourself in excel?

title: Social Media Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process and straight to the point. Very nice and friendly people who know a lot about social media. I learned a lot from this experience and still am in touch with them today!
Interview Questions:
What’s your background?
What do you want to do in the future?
How can we help you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The overall interview process was easy, informative, and fast. I appreciate that the hiring manager respected my time and kept their word on the intended hiring timeline. Very clear expectations for the position were put in place, and communication was active and timely.
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?

How has your past experience prepared you for this job?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions with out any read curve balls. Friendly and nice. Ended up feeling like a conversation and like an approachable boss. She even gave me a tour after we were done taking.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Marketing Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview scheduling process at Pitt was easy and they set up interviews quickly.  The actual interview was very fair and they staff asked great questions. The staff were very friendly.

The only problem was that they set up a series of 5 interviews at one time before knowing that they even wanted to move on to the next step with me.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time that you had to manage a difficult situation by confronting your manager.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: It was a long interview. kind of overwhelming yet everyone was friendly. That helped to make it go by a little faster.  in the end, it probably made sense being that length.
Interview Questions: I can’t quite remember any. :(

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Applied and interviewed for like 20 mins about my qualifications and experience, super quick and easy to talk to the principal investigator, offered the job immediately so it was a good experience overall
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want this job

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Very nice experience. Collegial and intellectual.  They will work to make you feel comfortable and engage with your research. The campus is nice and the people are warm. A good place to start a career.
Interview Questions: How will you teach sensitive issues?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I applied as an internal candidate. Woman from the department emailed me the next day to set up a 30 min phone call. We have the phone call, I honestly thought it went very well. I followed up, she didn't respond. I got an automatic email stating I am no longer considered. I email her again asking what I could have done differently to get a second interview. She ghosted me. I know people are busy, but being ghosted is extremely unprofessional and I already work here at the University. I can only imagine how rude interviewers are if you are an external candidate.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy to schedule and the overall process was well-planned. Parking at the interview site was covered for the in-person interview. The environment of the interview site and the overall atmosphere was nice and calm. Most questions were very easy.
Interview Questions: What my future goals were

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very communicative and flexible setting up an interview with me.  Due to the pandemic my interview was conducted via Zoom.  Other members of the team were present on the interview as well.
Interview Questions: I was asked some standard questions about my past experience and how it relates to the skills required for the position.  I was also asked about my communication style and how I manage conflict.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. 2 interviews. The first one with PI.  Another with all the lab members. 15 min with each lab member. Everybody was very cordial. Then one member showed me the lab.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this university?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: standard dry interview process and going over resume standard dry interview process and going over resume standard dry interview process and going over resume standard dry interview process and going over resume
Interview Questions: main question were on availability and skills

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of behavioral questions and the duration was 3 hours with multiple sections. Panel members made me comfortable during the interview. Had technical questions from java, SQL, and past work experience.
Interview Questions: Did you face any challenges in the previous assignment and how did you overcome the challenges?

title: IT Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It started with a Phone Interview to get to know more about the position and discussed some of my resume. Then a Zoom interview with 5 interviewers.  The zoom interview lasted an hour and we dove more in depth on some scenarios with the experience I had.
Interview Questions: Why did you delay getting into Cyber Security?

title: System Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Remote interview focused on job duties. Professional process and staff was friendly. We both seemed to realize that my skillset was not a perfect fit for the job, but the experience as a whole was positive.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in a specific IT technology?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly laid back and easy. I interviewed for multiple labs and it was all very informal meetings with PI and lab managers. I spoke about my past experiences and what I was looking to do in the future as well.
Interview Questions: Past experiences in research and what lab I was associated with

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: My professor interviewed me based on how I did in the class and my availability. It was relatively easy and the class I interviewed for was fun to teach. I also had to know how to react in situations where students had questions that I could answer or questions that I did not know the answer to.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student had a question that you could not answer?

title: Clinical Veterinarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the attending veterinarian. The next step led me to an on-site interview which last approximately 1.5-2 days. I met several staff and toured many areas including one site that was over 20 mins away.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied in late spring, very long time between contacts. First interview, one week before hearing back, another week until a second interview. Then a few weeks silence, heard back and officially hired 3 months after first interview.
Interview Questions: What is your background like?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: They called me first, and then invited me for an onsite interview. They planned a 2-day interview for me. I spoke to everyone that was working in the lab at the time.
Interview Questions: They just asked me very generic questions.

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The lead interviewer let you introduce yourself at first, and then ask several questions that already talked or indicated in the previous emails. It's better to prepare a show case to let them know more about what you could do.
Interview Questions: Do you have something to show us about  xxxxxx (past experience)?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I did a zoom interview that lasted about twenty minutes. It was pretty straightforward and structured, as they were doing more than a few interviews that day . I felt comfortable. I was interviewed by three people at once, as I recall.
Interview Questions: how have you handled past crisis situations?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself wasn't bad; I was interviewed on a panel of 4. However, the pay was simply too low compared to the market rate and I did not accept the position after being offered.
Interview Questions: How would you make an effort to get involved in the University of Pittsburgh community?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application through Pitt HR and was invited for an interview about a week later, A few weeks after that, I was asked to do a second interview. Both interviews were by Zoom.
Interview Questions:
Describe your relevant work experience
Describe your supervisory experience

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: One interview over zoom after applying. A very casual interview where you are asked about prior experience and interests in the opportunity.  Easily doable especially for a student worker position. Not a lot of time commitment for the job.
Interview Questions: What have you done in the past?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process for my fellowship. That may not be the case in other departments. The university is a pretty good employer especially when it comes to flexible working such as remote working
Interview Questions: There we no interview question

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: During COVID: met with PI over Microsoft Teams. She described the project and asked general questions about my experience. She mentioned it was the first time she ever conducted a job interview. She was looking for someone to start her first research team with, which should have been advertised as "Study coordinator" instead of "research assistant" in my opinion.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer working individually or as part of a team?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Included your standard easy interview questions. Interview was about 30 minutes and the hiring manager was kind/attentive which made the process less stressful. She gave typical time at the end for me to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple deadlines or juggle multiple priorities competing for your attention?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: They were very cordial. Asked me to walk through my resume in detail, explaining why I moved on from each position and how each would help me in this role.
Interview Questions: What makes me a good fit for this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview directly from boss. Very simple. Easy to navigate onboarding and clearances for student position. Various clearances to go through for job but overall easy to navigate. Talent center for listings is very straightforward.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple, took place over Skype with two current research assistants. Both asked me questions about past experience in research and managing study duties. After interview, lab manager contacted me via email to let me know I had not received the position. Email could have been more timely, they contacted me about two months later.
Interview Questions: What part of the job would be hardest for you?

title: Communications Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Easy, straight forward. Had call with current intern and supervisor over Zoom. Had a few tough questions about specifics of position but nothing impossible. One situational "what would you do" style questions.
Interview Questions: How would you create a Facebook Ads campaign for this?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate/Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal candidate.  My interview process involved meeting with the research supervisor and the other individuals in the lab.  I was asked questions about my interests and how I would approach problems.
Interview Questions: What kinds of projects would you be interested in conducting here?

title: Health and Fitness Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple but the turn around time took over a month. There were little updates and when Pitt finally decided to offer the job, they wanted a decision right away.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to our team that makes you stand out?

title: Panther Central Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Started with a quick 10 minute phone screen then got called back for an in person interview, process was about a week. Everyone was really friendly which took a lot of the pressure off.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple projects?

title: MED Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: This was a classic interview, though mine was on Zoom. We had 2 faculty rounds, a medical student round, and a group interview. The faculty interviews were basic and asked about experience/resume stuff. The student one was more chill, and you could ask about their experience at Pitt. Finally, the group round was regarding a medical ethics/question or scenario, and you discuss it with the group under the monitoring of a student or faculty member.
Interview Questions: Resume, Experience, Ethics, Challenges, basic med stuff

title: First Year Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds, the first being a group interview and the second with the program coordinator and a student director. Both were fairly relaxed, they asked questions about how I would plan an event for incoming students.
Interview Questions: How would you plan an event for first year students?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Lots of great communication with he hiring manager. However, many more finalists that what would be considered typical were brought on campus for in-person interviews. Don't forget, academic interviews are often all day and include multiple small group interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe an area in which you think you would like to grow in this position.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2019

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Oct 2019

title: Post Award Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2019

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and cover letter on job application portal,  got email from the Professor in about 2 weeks. There was only one round interview with the professor, describing some of your previous research projects.
Interview Questions:
Tell me something about yourself.
Tell me about your last project.

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via phone call to setup an initial interview. Received this call about a week after applying. I interviewed with someone within the department and it lasted about an hour.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and casual. One phone call, an in person meeting, and then was hired. The discussion was with the supervisor that I would be working under, so it made sense for the simplicity of the job.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I had a talk with our professor about my experience, skills, interests, and what the position requires. It was more like a chat with my professor. Then we decided to start the project.
Interview Questions: My knowledge with the subject and the programmings

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty straight forward and lasted about 30 minutes. However 5 references were required to be considered for an entry level job and the job description sounded vague in person as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy, friendly, professional, to the point, relevant, no pressure, honest, approachable, own staffing office, all start as temps, don't egg you on. Interested in background, asked about what position you'd like. They offer options.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Grant Development Funding Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant interviewing process where I met with both the hiring manager and his supervisor. Everyone I spoke with was professional, kind, and showed a lot of enthusiasm about what they do. The overall interview process included a one on one phone call and an in person meeting.
Interview Questions: How do you juggle multiple priorities?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was thorough and conducted through Pitt source online. There was a 3 week wait time and then I interviewed. I eventually, was hired a week later. The interview was very informal and based on soft skills.
Interview Questions: are you able to produce content and work independently?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Standard grad school application with submission of all related test results, resume, and research statement. The deadline is usually a few weeks later compared to other schools, which helps. The admission/rejection decision is communicated quickly.
Interview Questions: No interviews, just decision made from the committee

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Applied on PittSource for CS/UTA/PEER TUTOR, then got invited to an interview in person. The interview was not technical. They required letters of recommendations from faculty and good grades (A- or better).
Interview Questions: General Behavioral Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses.

title: Guide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: the kid before me actually sang during his interview, and they make you cheer loudly. there were a few rounds of interviews, i think 3. also, you have to answer what you had for breakfast.
Interview Questions: they just asked about eleadership

title: Director, Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
A phone screener led me through a series of mechanical questions, few of which had any direct connection to the role posted. The screener requested some follow up information, which I emailed. That was the last contact I had with her and never heard anything further. 

It's possible my negative experience was dependent on the screener. From the moment the conversation began, she seemed annoyed and put off. I had hoped to explain how my experience well suited the open role, however, she was more interested in dates and locations of previous jobs. The more I tried to explain my practical experience and skill set, the more irritated she seemed to become. In fact, I began to wonder if she was really familiar with the role she was trying to fill. An off day? Maybe, but a follow up email to thank me for sharing the additional information she had requested or an update that the position had been filled would have been courteous. Unfortunately, the experience has put me off considering Pitt for a long time. There *are* more gracious employers in the Pittsburgh region.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with difficult people?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It takes a few rounds and some time, but the questions are great and really focused on both your attitude as well as your expertise. You'll gradually climb the ladder of who you'll be working under and with. Early interview panels are selected with people you are most likely to work with on a day-to-day basis.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple tasks?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I found various job postings on the University of Pittsburgh website, which can be found at the University of Pittsburgh Office of Human Resources website. I was required to create an online account, then complete a brief online form. After completing the form, I responded to multiple calls and emails, before traveling to campus for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: What was my work history?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a lab position in the bioengineering labs as a student. They wanted to pay very little for the amount of work being generated but I needed it for my degree.
Interview Questions: What bioengineering track are you on and what are your interests?

title: Research Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Professional, a lot of detail question was asked and very informative. Interviewer also has detail explanation to he position itself. Had second interview with administrator and she is very nice and experienced on what the job is
Interview Questions: What system you have been used in the past

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Sent resume via email and heard back within 2 weeks. 1:1 interview with professor who entirely focused on personality and behavioral fit for the position. Relaxed in-person interview walking through my resume and got an acceptance notification a few days after
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student providing flattering remarks to influence their grade?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: 2 Interviewers and 2 candidates together, each taking turns to ask and answer questions. A very casual environment, business professional is definitely not required for the interview or the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult customer.

title: Ph D Candidate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a 1-hour interview with the Ph.D. student of the professor I had mentioned in my statement of purpose. It was not a very difficult interview. He mostly asked me the routine questions about my publications and research experience.
Interview Questions: How would you rank yourself in Mathematics, Academic Writing, and Programming skills?

title: Grants Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: First contact through email and after first interview, about 30 or 45 minutes, they’re contacting with you through email and you can have second interview. You can see your interview status in there website
Interview Questions: What’s most difficult challenge you have found?

title: Student Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was composed of a ten minute phone screen, a 45 minute in-person interview with three supervisors, and an offer over the phone. I applied in June, got the phone screen in early August, and was offered the position last week of August.

title: Facility Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was challenging at first but not too difficult. The interviewers were very supportive and understanding. It was a positive experience. I would recommend it to a friend. Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet.
Interview Questions: What leadership experience do you have?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I was never interviewed - got a job without an interview, which I thought was strange. But they hired me right before the semester began, so they probably didn't have time.
Interview Questions: As I said in the previous answer, I was never interviewed.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions:
Met with PI, discussed my interests/motivation/goals, general lab directives, current available projects, etc.  
The PI I interviewed with was a professor of mine, so we already had a reasonable amount of familiarity.  Going in cold with a strange PI will certainly be a more formal process.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to accomplish by working in this lab on x project?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: No technical questions asked. Be honest. They look for prior experience as a TA or grader. Easy to crack. Professors are cool and friendly. Try to be casual. Keep follow p with HR and maintain a good repo.
Interview Questions: DO you have prior experience with grading ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy. They responded back to me fairly quickly and the people who interviewed me were very welcoming. The questions were  very casual and I enjoyed the experience
Interview Questions: How  will your experience benefit your potential work here?

title: Marketing Communications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview, a face-to-face with the director and then some team members, a second interview with the director and two additional senior level staff, and a lunch meeting.
Interview Questions: Describe how social media can increase admissions.

title: Software Developer With CTSI Dpeartment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was fairly simply, initial round was just about my career interests and my experience.
At first the team was very responsive and answered my questions patiently. For the next round it was skype call happened in the month of June and then there was no response until July 17th. I followed up with them for almost 6 times thru email and countless times thru phone. 

After all these happened when I ask for feedback or where did I go wrong, today one of the team member called me and talked to me rudely for following up with them multiple times, said there is no feed back and shut the phone on my face without any proper response
Interview Questions: Nothing much difficult,  asked basic OOD questions and behavioral questions

title: Sustainable Transportation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: met with boss and few directors. long process but easy interview. easy and basic questions asked. just prepare for behavioral questions. the process took many weeks. met with my boss then the director. then a week after i was extended an offer
Interview Questions:
what do you like to do in your free time?
previous work experience

title: Pitt CSSD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, asked basic questions. They brought me in with a group of people from the CSSD and asked me basic interview questions. I was accepted and accepted the job offer.
Interview Questions: What is a strength of yours?

title: Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via phone and in person in a group interview with faculty and staff members present. The entire process lasted about two weeks or so. It was an easy interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you dealt with it.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview process was very good. I was asked fair and honest questions. The process consisted of a face to face interview with the hiring manager from the department. I felt very comfortable in this type of interview atmosphere.
Interview Questions: The department made sure to ask in depth questions about my previous experience.  They really wanted to make sure I had the experience needed to succeed in the role.

title: Visitor Center Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: About a month after I applied, I received an email asking for a phone/Skype interview. That was for 30 minutes with the person who is now my supervisor. About a week later, I was informed I got an in-person interview and that was the following week. After the in-person, I was told that I would hear the following week. They were transparent during the whole process and I always knew when to expect a follow up from them.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a negative and positive customer service experience you had.

title: Assistant Director of Graphic Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Conducted a couple phone interviews over the course of a week. Fairly informal but got into more concrete and serious discussions. After the second one, never heard back, even after reaching out, despite being told I would in a few days.
Interview Questions: What work are you most proud of?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online when job was posted. Got a callback for a Skype interview a day later. Had the Skype interview then a week later had what was suppose to be a 30 min in person interview with 3 reps. The first two reps were very professional, but rushed through the interview. (Only lasted 15 mins) The third rep I was suppose to interview with ended up being unavailable to interview. I was suppose to hear back from them it’s been 2 weeks and nothing. Very rude and unprofessional
Interview Questions: Tell us something about yourself that’s not on your resume

title: Compliance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Lasted a little over an hour. The entire department was present for the interview (very small department). Everyone was very personable and laid back. Overall it was a very positive experience. They said it may be 2 weeks before they make a decision, however.
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses and how would you go about improving them?

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Came into her office and she described what the job would be like. Very Casual. The woman talked a lot about the typical day and introduced me to current tutors.
Interview Questions: Do you think you could handle working with the students?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very casual for students. Brief overview of career interests and why I wanted the job. I met with two of the employees I'd report up to and received a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Got an email with some dates available for an interview about 2 weeks later. Interviewed with the manager and supervisor separately. Typical job interview.... tell me about youself....
Interview Questions: what is your greatest strength and your greatest weakness

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: The manager was very friendly and informative and made sure that I felt at ease during the interview. She was straightforward and easy to deal with, no issues with scheduling or otherwise.
Interview Questions: Whether i was willing to travel

title: Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Over an hour long and very hard questions.  The length of the interview also made it exhausting.  There were 3 interviewers, one of which walked in looking irritated right off the bat.
Interview Questions: What are your technical skills

title: Disability Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with an HR representative that went very well. Within a few days, I received another phone call to schedule an in-person interview. The interview was conducted with four or five members of the diversity "team". It was a pretty standard interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to serve as a team leader.

title: Executive Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with several members of the communications staff. They were all very friendly and asked some great questions. Overall, a very good experience. Quick follow-up after for a second interview.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in working at the University? What is my management style? How do I manage expectations of many departments and from the top down?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Letter of intent with an outline of planned research focus, then personal interviews with faculty over the course of two days, and finally a presentation to the whole group which included current work and future steps.
Interview Questions: Describe my research trajectory

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, interviewed one month later, and received an offer two weeks after that.The interview was in person with the PI and lasted roughly an hour, which included a tour of the lab and an introduction to the other staff member. It was pretty intense, involving designing experiments and troubleshooting issues.
Interview Questions: If you were to design the perfect BSL1 E. coli strain, what are all of the considerations you would have?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is straightforward - with direct supervisor of the position being interviewed for.  Interviews are in-person.  Each job position must interview a minimum of 3 individuals before making a selection unless a special waiver is obtained.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals with the University?

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted within 2 days of online application for interview with lab PI and team.  Interviewed the following week and met a variety of potential colleagues, received tour of facilities, treated to lunch, and met with PI to discuss position and qualifications.  Interview was very pleasant and personable until HR got involved.  HR rep gave verbal offer (Pitt refuses to provide written offers which is RIDICULOUS) which was ~10% low given my experience.  I counter-offered with a 10% increase and the HR rep balked and said they do not negotiate.  I thanked them for their time and let them know I would pursue another opportunity.  HR rep just hung up.  Absurd!  I suppose PhD and upper management are the only ones who are allowed to negotiate their pay.  This reeked of unprofessionalism.  I have always negotiated pay at other academic institutions and have never encountered such hostility as a prospective employee with an offer in-hand.  Steer clear of Pitt.
Interview Questions: Experience, qualifications, etc

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy.  not at all difficult.  it was kinda of a joke though.  i wouldn't recommend working here unless you get a job in one of the new biology/tech towers.  steep hills also deterred me
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I met with a grad student to discuss their research. It was pretty straight forward and interesting. I have been working for a while now learning laboratory procedures, it's a lot of fun!
Interview Questions: What is your previous lab experience?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took about 3-4 weeks to hear back regarding an interview date, another 3 weeks to receive an offer, another month before a start date. HR takes a while to process new employee paperwork.
Interview Questions: How does our project cater to your interests and experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked about my educational background, experience in the field and reasons I felt I would be fit for this role regarding the current study.
I was then given details about the study and the tasks I would be responsible for while the study was conducted.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you will be a good fit for this job?

title: Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Met with department chair and spoke to office staff in the hiring department.  Spoke to HR for a screening interview, then had appointment with department chair.  The process was quick, but never got a response to follow ups.  Didn't get job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Pitt?  What experience do you have with purchasing?  How would you deal with a difficult faculty member?

title: Major Gifts Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Confusing, not communicated well, and it took FOREVER to get an offer.  I ended up taking another position since it took HR so long to make an offer after being told an offer would be made. Left me with a bad feeling.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Nice environment, the research supervisor described requirements and duties  for this position, gave me a  tour around facility, introduced to research group, asked questions about my interests, schools,previous jobs, why decided to apply for this position and which classes from my degree would be relevant and/or helpful for this research project , what I considered as my strong sides, shortly introduced me  benefits and discussed  my ability and flexibility to work on different research sites.
Interview Questions: What do you know about oral bacterial flora( research was about connection of oral health and development of heart disease)

title: UTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was just ask questions like how do you like teaching, how do you keep plans, how your friends may introduce you. You are easily to be selected if you just apply for the position.
Interview Questions: How do you keep your plans?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth. I was called in for two interviews. The first was a phone interview and the second was in person. The interviewers were very friendly and warm and made me feel comfortable. The questions weren’t particularly difficult.
Interview Questions: Do you consider yourself a team player?

title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three people in the department. They all basically just asked about what was on my resume then asked when I would be able to start. Very low stress.
Interview Questions: When would you use Excel and when would you use Access?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, and the next step in the process was a skype interview. The in person interview was scheduled two months after the initial application. This required a design project that was to be completed and presented to four interviewers over the course of two hours. The project required a personal spin on a product they already had (advertising items for campus stores). The questions were all pretty standard and read from packets. The day before my interview, after I turned in the design project for review, the department receptionist emailed me saying they were unsure of where the department was in the process. This was a mistake that shook me up quite a bit, especially since I put quite some work into my presentation. I was then informed that email was for someone else.

A month after the interview, I reached out again to see where the process was. I was given such a vague answer and told to reach out to the personnel coordinator, who had a similar response. I received a letter of regret three months after the original job posting. When I reached out for direct feedback, the only response was that the department was going in a different direction. I again rephrased my question for direct feedback regarding the project, but the personnel coordinator did not respond or help me contact the correct person. A concern I have is that the university will use my designs for their benefit without my knowledge (this has happened to me before with interview based projects).
Interview Questions: Something unique you would like to be remembered by?

title: Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone interview and then 3-hour on-campus interview with a 15 minute presentation plus a Skype call with the Director. The phone interview had two people on the call and the 3-hour presentation had 1 hour with three or four people and the other hour with leadership team folks (three other people) and a final Skype call with the Director
Interview Questions: Most questions were behavioral in nature. Tell me about a time when...

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then in-person interview. Questions were fairly straightforward. Asked about my work history and why I wanted to work there. Very friendly in person, but then they decided to not fill the position. The in-person interview was over 2 hours long and mostly they talked about the department and the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in higher education?

title: Compliance Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR representative. Standard introductory questions. A few days later, I was contacted to set up an in-person interview. Four members of the supervising committee were present for the interview. They each took turns asking a few questions. It was pretty standard, and I was impressed by their interest in my answers.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge you faced with others at work and how did you deal with it?

title: Secretary III - Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Bradford, PA)
Interview Descriptions: A panel of 6 staff and faculty took turns asking questions relating to the position, my qualifications and personal objectives. The interview was somewhat informal and I was made to feel as at ease as you can in an interview by a panel.
Interview Questions: Where I would like to be in 5 years.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well. Asked very basic questions. Discussed about the role and our chance meeting several years ago in Canada. I thought everything went smooth when they asked to email my references. They asked me to contact them if I dont hear back from them in 2 weeks. Its been 4 months and despite several attempts they kept repeating still under review and eventually the job posting was canceled.
Interview Questions: They asked to describe my project during my masters

title: Donor Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back within 2 weeks to set up an interview for the following week. The interview was with 2 people within the department and took approximately an hour. Everyone was kind and courteous and didn't seem to be looking for 'gotcha' questions. Post interview, HR process is very slow.
Interview Questions: They asked me to explain a professional mistake I'd learned from.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Flown in for an interview. Met with 4-5 professors for a "speed round" of interviews. The department is small and felt very homey. They treated the interviewees to lunch and we had a very nice hotel accommodation.
Interview Questions: What are your interests?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position, and was offered an interview about 1-2 weeks after my application. The two interviewers asked about my previous job experience, my familiarity with website design, social media, and graphic design. They also asked some standard behavioral interview questions. I was told that I would receive a response the following week, but I didn't hear anything from either interviewer. I emailed both of the interviewers two weeks after to ask about the status of the position. I didn't get a response, so I tried again one week later. No response once again, at which point I didn't bother to get in contact with them again. More than two months after my interview, I received an automated rejection over email. I didn't mind the rejection, but I thought it was rude of the interviewers to ignore all communication. Sometimes it's nice to know what's going on and not be in the dark for three months.
Interview Questions: What skills can you offer the team?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: We talked about 15 minutes. the director was very nice, easy-going, energetic and concerned. it's a casual interview. We just had the interview in a casually selected office which was quiet.
Interview Questions: Talk about your former experience working with children.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, had it in the lab manager's messy office. I overdressed for a lab position. I knew someone who also worked in the division so I believe that this helped me both with the interview and the getting the job because I was a dime a dozen candidate, fresh out of college with little experience.
Interview Questions: What experience I have had in the past with lab work.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions:
I filled out application and cover letter then had a Skype interview
Next I was given an assignment to create a presentation.  Finally, I presented to a panel.  About a week later, I was called in to the director's office to accept my contract.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about travel?

title: Animal Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back. We mostly discussed the job role and briefly went over my education and other credentials. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and they offered me the job by the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with animals in a research setting before?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I basically submitted my CV to the Pitt source and got in contact with the PI. It was a continuation of my undergrad so there was some bias towards me.
Interview Questions: What were my interests and why do you want to work here

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university of Pittsburgh's website. Someone contacted me and I had a short telephone interview. Then, I came into the office to have an interview with one person. She was very friendly and easy going. The questions were standard. They were all from a packet she had. Later, was asked to do a mock phone call.
Interview Questions: The questions were very standard. Strengths, weaknesses, etc.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Its a good transparent interview process. Not very difficult. Mostly asked about past experiences. 
What skillset you have? 
What did you work on during your PhD? 
What techniques do you know?
Whether you have any transferable skills?
Interview Questions: Experience, salary expectations

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied using online website. This was a job that I had applied to a year earlier and didn't get. I thought I would reapply this time around. Received a call a few days later, and was invited for an interview the next week. Interview was a little over one hour. A week later, I receive a call from the hiring manager. She told me that she wanted to offer the position to me, but that Pitt had to contact my current supervisor for a reference before I could be hired. The hiring manager told me that she could call my current boss now for the reference, or that Pitt's Human Resources could give me the offer first, and then she would call my current boss for the reference.

I didn't want my current boss knowing that I was planning on getting another position for various reasons. I replied that I would rather hear the offer first, and if I the offer was good enough, they could then call my current boss. I now realize that sounds a little greedy, but it was coming from a place of concern, so bosses get angry when they find out an employee wants to leave.

When HR called me about 30 minutes later, the offer was for a salary that was thousands of dollars less than I currently make. I was told there was no negotiation. LOL So I had to decline it since I had no reason to accept less money (I already have great benefits as my current job).

I emailed the hiring manager to thank her for her time, and tell her that I understood if she couldn't budge, and Happy Holidays. She never responded to me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to meet a deadline.

title: Intellectual Property and Licensing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Boston, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: applied online, they got back to me a month later to set up a phone interview. The phone interview lasted an hour, talking about the position, the workplace, and what they wanted from a candidate. The process took forever after that though. They said they would try to get back to me before they went on winter break but never did. I accepted another position before i heard back from them on 2/1/16.
Interview Questions: Do you have lab experience?

title: Personnel Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was behavioral based.  I took the day off to go to the interview.   It seemed to go well.  I never heard back - at all - from Pitt.   No rejection letter or email, nothing.   It was very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with non-responsive managers?

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: The first in-person job interview is typically a one-on-one interview between the applicant and a hiring manager. The interviewer will ask questions about the applicant's experience and skills, work history, availability, and the qualifications the company is seeking in the optimal candidate for the job.
Interview Questions: Basic computer knowledge and other behavioral questions

title: Employer Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: The time span between the first phone interview and the in person interview was quick. The on site interview was way too long and involved far too many people. The interview lasted over 5 hours and included panels, multiple 1:1 sessions, and a presentation with a topic that was not well thought out at all - it had very little to do with the job itself. It took over a month for them to make a decision after that date.
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral questions - nothing too out of the ordinary - just A LOT of them.

title: Administrator III Interview
Application Type: The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called for an interview 4 months after applying. Upon check in I noticed I was one of maybe 12 people being interviewed. Met with hiring manager and Chair of dept. Was asked why I applied, about current position, and about a few skills that were NOT listed on job posting. Whole interview lasted maybe 15 minutes. Was obvious I was a fill in for their numbers to HR. Got a form letter in the mail about 3 weeks later saying the position was filled.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply for this position?

title: Inside Sales Representative I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial interview with a sales rep manager at a job fair and then was moved to the next round. I then had an in-person interview with three different sales rep manager which lasted approximately one hour. Also, because one of the sales rep managers could not attend this in-person interview, I then had a phone interview with him. After this process I was then moved onto the next round where I had to complete a 30/60/90 day business plan. No instruction was given on this step. I submitted the business plan, but did not move to a further round beyond this.
Interview Questions: How does your current position specifically prepare you for a job as an inside sales rep?

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were about four rounds of interviews during which I had to meet multiple supervisors. Each interview was more like an informal conversation, because everyone was so laid back. It was a good experience, but took about a month and a half until I was offered the position. I would recommend applying for the benefits of working for a university.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rather straightforward.  I had already had experience doing research on campus, and so I knew basically what they would ask about.  Not like a corporate interview, much more personal and to see if you and the laboratory principal investigator will get along.  Know what you want to research, experience necessary.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my experience in a laboratory and if I had basic knowledge.  As a neuroscience major, I was experienced.

title: Major Gifts Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was three months after submitting before I received a request for an interview and six months before receiving an offer. The lengthy application process is not unusual.  Before going in for the interview I reviewed all three relevant posted positions and only found out when I arrived that I was being interviewed for two separate positions, neither of which were posted online.  Interviewers were professional and friendly.
Interview Questions: What is the largest gift you have brought it?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online over two months ago and didn't receive a call until recently.  Face to face interview was set with hiring manager.  No initial phone screen.  Met with the hiring manager and the interview was very conversational and informative than the typical formal structured interview.  It allowed an honest exchange of information between hiring manager and candidate.  Received notification from hiring manager that she had instructed HR to extend offer.  This is the probably the greatest break in the process as HR has a reputation to not be responsive enough to continue the process timely.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for Pitt?

title: Information Technology Specialist Interview

title: Systems Programmer III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online through PittSource (the university's online job posting system).  Application required 3 references, complete job/salary and education experience.  Four weeks after I applied (I actually applied for two positions in the same department), I received an email requesting a date and time for a phone interview regarding both positions. The call consisted of two team members of the department.  The phone interview required a walk through of a coding example (I was not able to access the internet at the time so we did it verbally).  After the sample, we discussed previous work experiences as related to coding and testing, the position and department, expectations, salary, and benefits.  I was told during the call that they wanted me back in for a second interview, and that someone would be in touch with me within the next couple of weeks.  I received another email two days later requesting an in person interview with the two team members I spoke with on the phone, the interview was set up for the following Tuesday (8 days after the phone interview).

I was used to onsite interviews, this one was a little different.  I was in a room with the team members and was asked to code two samples in Java (routine examples).  They were straight forward, however I had more experience with hardware than software.  The difference between this interview and others was how the interviewers interacted with me.  I was talking my way through, bouncing ideas off of them, and received solid feedback on my ideas.  Usually in most interviews, I would get a stare or be told they couldn’t help.  After the coding samples, there were “theoretical” questions.  I was asked about examples on synchronization, programming limitations (hardware bound), and others.  Lastly, I was shown some of the projects the team currently, and previously, worked on.

I was called the next day to be informed, that assuming all the paperwork went through and that my references were solid, I would be getting an official offer.  That same day, all my references called me to tell me Pitt called them.  Two weeks later, I received the official offer. From initial application date, the process took about two months.  From first interview to official offer, took about three and a half weeks.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had to perform calculations on millions of data points and each calculation is 5 seconds, how would I speed it up?
