Post interview, HR process is very slow.
Interview Questions: They asked me to explain a professional mistake I'd learned from.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Flown in for an interview. Met with 4-5 professors for a "speed round" of interviews. The department is small and felt very homey. They treated the interviewees to lunch and we had a very nice hotel accommodation.
Interview Questions: What are your interests?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position, and was offered an interview about 1-2 weeks after my application. The two interviewers asked about my previous job experience, my familiarity with website design, social media, and graphic design. They also asked some standard behavioral interview questions. I was told that I would receive a response the following week, but I didn't hear anything from either interviewer. I emailed both of the interviewers two weeks after to ask about the status of the position. I didn't get a response, so I tried again one week later. No response once again, at which point I didn't bother to get in contact with them again. More than two months after my interview, I received an automated rejection over email. I didn't mind the rejection, but I thought it was rude of the interviewers to ignore all communication. Sometimes it's nice to know what's going on and not be in the dark for three months.
Interview Questions: What skills can you offer the team?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: We talked about 15 minutes. the director was very nice, easy-going, energetic and concerned. it's a casual interview. We just had the interview in a casually selected office which was quiet.
Interview Questions: Talk about your former experience working with children.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, had it in the lab manager's messy office. I overdressed for a lab position. I knew someone who also worked in the division so I believe that this helped me both with the interview and the getting the job because I was a dime a dozen candidate, fresh out of college with little experience.
Interview Questions: What experience I have had in the past with lab work.

title: Research Fellow Interview

Interview Descriptions:
I filled out application and cover letter then had a Skype interview
Next I was given an assignment to create a presentation.  Finally, I presented to a panel.  About a week later, I was called in to the director's office to accept my contract.

title: Animal Care Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back. We mostly discussed the job role and briefly went over my education and other credentials. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and they offered me the job by the end of the interview.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2015

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university of Pittsburgh's website. Someone contacted me and I had a short telephone interview. Then, I came into the office to have an interview with one person. She was very friendly and easy going. The questions were standard. They were all from a packet she had. Later, was asked to do a mock phone call.
Interview Questions: The questions were very standard. Strengths, weaknesses, etc.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:

What skillset you have? 
What did you work on during your PhD? 
What techniques do you know?
Whether you have any transferable skills?
Interview Questions: Experience, salary expectations

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied using online website. This was a job that I had applied to a year earlier and didn't get. I thought I would reapply this time around. Received a call a few days later, and was invited for an interview the next week. Interview was a little over one hour. A week later, I receive a call from the hiring manager. She told me that she wanted to offer the position to me, but that Pitt had to contact my current supervisor for a reference before I could be hired. The hiring manager told me that she could call my current boss now for the reference, or that Pitt's Human Resources could give me the offer first, and then she would call my current boss for the reference.

I didn't want my current boss knowing that I was planning on getting another position for various reasons. I replied that I would rather hear the offer first, and if I the offer was good enough, they could then call my current boss. I now realize that sounds a little greedy, but it was coming from a place of concern, so bosses get angry when they find out an employee wants to leave.

When HR called me about 30 minutes later, the offer was for a salary that was thousands of dollars less than I currently make. I was told there was no negotiation. LOL So I had to decline it since I had no reason to accept less money (I already have great benefits as my current job).

I emailed the hiring manager to thank her for her time, and tell her that I understood if she couldn't budge, and Happy Holidays. She never responded to me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to meet a deadline.

title: Intellectual Property and Licensing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Boston, MA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: applied online, they got back to me a month later to set up a phone interview. The phone interview lasted an hour, talking about the position, the workplace, and what they wanted from a candidate. The process took forever after that though. They said they would try to get back to me before they went on winter break but never did. I accepted another position before i heard back from them on 2/1/16.
Interview Questions: Do you have lab experience?

title: Personnel Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2015

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview

title: Project Coordinator Interview

title: Systems Programmer III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online through PittSource (the university's online job posting system).  Application required 3 references, complete job/salary and education experience.  Four weeks after I applied (I actually applied for two positions in the same department), I received an email requesting a date and time for a phone interview regarding both positions. The call consisted of two team members of the department.  The phone interview required a walk through of a coding example (I was not able to access the internet at the time so we did it verbally).  After the sample, we discussed previous work experiences as related to coding and testing, the position and department, expectations, salary, and benefits.  I was told during the call that they wanted me back in for a second interview, and that someone would be in touch with me within the next couple of weeks.  I received another email two days later requesting an in person interview with the two team members I spoke with on the phone, the interview was set up for the following Tuesday (8 days after the phone interview).

I was used to onsite interviews, this one was a little different.  I was in a room with the team members and was asked to code two samples in Java (routine examples).  They were straight forward, however I had more experience with hardware than software.  The difference between this interview and others was how the interviewers interacted with me.  I was talking my way through, bouncing ideas off of them, and received solid feedback on my ideas.  Usually in most interviews, I would get a stare or be told they couldn’t help.  After the coding samples, there were “theoretical” questions.  I was asked about examples on synchronization, programming limitations (hardware bound), and others.  Lastly, I was shown some of the projects the team currently, and previously, worked on.

I was called the next day to be informed, that assuming all the paperwork went through and that my references were solid, I would be getting an official offer.  That same day, all my references called me to tell me Pitt called them.  Two weeks later, I received the official offer. From initial application date, the process took about two months.  From first interview to official offer, took about three and a half weeks.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had to perform calculations on millions of data points and each calculation is 5 seconds, how would I speed it up?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview

Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview. After obtaining admission to the PhD program, I send my CV to a professor and was recruited to this position. This kind of jobs are based on availability of funding and the fit between your research interests and your recruiter.

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Student Library Assistant Interview

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via the University of Pittsburgh website.  I got a call about two weeks later to set up a Skype interview.  The Skype interview was with four members of the Pitt staff.  It was wonderful!  So much better than a 15 minute phone screening!  The interview was about a half hour long, but only because I had questions to ask and they provided thorough answers.  They stopped questioning after about 15 minutes.  Everyone was so conversational and friendly.  I had that interview on a Friday and got a phone call on Monday to schedule an in person interview.  The in person interview was scheduled the following Monday.  I interviewed with Dr. James Earle for the first hour and then with two members of the Pitt Staff who had higher positions than the initial Skype interview. I have not found out yet about an offer or otherwise, but I had such a good experience I still count it as a win!

2) Name three weaknesses.  This was hard for me because I only had one prepared. haha

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple personal interview, single stage.  There are a variety of positions to apply for, but each should only require a one-on-one with a managing authority (usually your future supervisor).  Dress well, be amicable, have good social skills, and know enough background to survive an orientation session or two and you should not be bad off.
Interview Questions:
What skills do you have?
When are you free/able to start?
When will you be graduating?  (assuming you are still a student)

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: First, there is a email that notify me about an interview, then I scheduled a time for interview. After the interview, we had the second interview on phone within one week. Before she make the final decision, she also understands that I will be able to come to the training. The environment is great. People are very nice here.
Interview Questions: Tell me one instance when you work with difficult people

title: Administrative Support III Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process for the work study positions is very laid back and not that involved, but that is probably because it is a student part-time position! My boss met with me and took me on a tour of the office and asked me about myself and my studies, and just tried to get a feel of if I can juggle everything!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: This is an intensive process involving multiple rounds including personal interviews. There is a groups process involving teamwork and trying to stand out in crowd. It was important to stand out without being controlling. Also, there was 1-1 interviews which was relaxing but kind of in depth.
Interview Questions: Incorporating OCC

title: Computer Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: basic interview questions, how did you hear about the position, discussed hours
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a dispute with a coworker and what did you do to resolve it?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: On-site interview
Interview Questions: Need to explain detailed explanations of your works

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: normal hiring process (tech, HR)
Interview Questions: varies techniques including programming language and open source frameworks

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to give a presentation on the lab meeting.
Interview Questions: The questions are mostly related to my presentation.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, just need to go through Professor. Very quick process. University helps with visa and all paper work. You need to be prepared to spend few days by exchanging the e-mails. Visits and choosing also possible, but you would need to cover expenses by yourself. In general recommended and nice interviewing. No stress or stupid questions. No drug testing or similar.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Applciation followed by in person interview. Pretty standard
Interview Questions: Why is RNase activity of HIV needed?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Job was uploaded to forum for research associate in the business school. The position was mostly data entry based on advertisement analysis. The questions consisted of personal background and education. It was a quick process because I was currently a student and federal aid applied to them hiring me.
Interview Questions: Just asked about classes and courses.

title: Web Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with VP of department and 2 Director levels.  Interview was held in the office I would be working in.  Lots of questions about how to handle customers.  They questioned my reasoning for applying for the job.  I was offered the job within a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: About how I handled moving projects along

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and easy, basically just making sure you are of a sound mind.  Interviewer is very nice and just tries to make sure you can handle the workload of work and school.  Makes it very clear she wants to hire you, and as long as you are available during the hours she needs, you will get the job.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this job to apply to?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Bradford, PA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Length interview process with 3 groups of people.  Everyone was very friendly and encouraging!  It took about a month to hear back with an offer, which was frustrating.
Interview Questions: One questions was, the traditional where do you see yourself in 5 years...

title: Assistant Professor of Economics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: send cv, recommendation letters, research papers at  first, and then receive a phone interview. Four or five interviewer are from different backgrounds, like economic professor, management professor, sociology professor. If passing the phone interview, the next step is campus visit. It is a very typical academic job hiring and interview process.
Interview Questions: Can you teach finance course?

title: Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: After initially applying online, the process began with an initial phone screen.  The second interview was a panel interview with Directors and student staff that focused on behavioral based questions.  The second round interview also included a mock appointment with a student.
Interview Questions: The most difficult was the mock appointment during the panel interview.  Having a one-on-one discussion with a student while being watched by several people was tough.

title: Sports Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: 2 in person Interviews
Interview Questions: What would you change about the Athletic Department?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: select by professors
Interview Questions: communication

title: Russian and Eastern European Studies Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Staff was courteous and gave a thorough overview of the position and qualities they were looking for in a new employee. The interview seemed geared toward ensuring that the candidate possessed the skill set necessary to perform the job adequately and was also forward-thinking enough to move the center in new directions in terms of incorporating new media, technological innovations and creativity into the position.
Interview Questions: Interview questions mostly pertained to skill sets they were seeking in the position--could the candidate interact professionally with academic authors, remain organized and juggle multiple assignments and priorities?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a professor stating why I was specifically interested in their research, what I wanted to do in the future, and why I would be a good fit for their lab. They replied quickly and asked me to come in for an informal interview and I was offered the position about a week later.
Interview Questions: What's your GPA?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: A presentation and meeting up with PI and other lab members. Had to go over the previous work from the lab and ask them questions displaying your ability to grasp and think critically.
Interview Questions: Questions pertaining to previous work

title: Executive Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview, which was followed by a panel interview that lasted for about 2 hours and final interview of an hour. It was a difficult interview and needed a lot of preparation and also make sure you arrive at least 30 minutes before the interview if you are not familiar with the area to give yourself ample time to find parking and also locate the building for the interview. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Research Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Very casual interview process with 3 employees.
I met with each employee (manager/director) individually (one at a time) in a conference room setting. They were dressed casual /dressy.  No suits.  They were very personable and wanted to know about me, my current job and what I do at it. Walk them through an average day.  They asked why I was leaving the current job and where I would see myself at this job.  They explained the job and the tasks that would need implemented daily and they asked of my education and skills I would use to do the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself here in 5 years.  What do you see yourself doing here and/or have accomplished in 5 years from now at the University.

title: Events Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty standard
Interview Questions: There weren't any questions that were tricky or unexpected.

title: Budget & Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Submit through online university hiring system. Hiring Manager will follow-up with initial interview (1 to 2 interviews). If hired, the hiring manager does not call the candidate, University HR does. The HR department will make an offer. Once offer is accepted (negotiations are possible) then employee orientation begins.
Interview Questions: Did not encounter an "unexpected question." All were standard interview questions.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very long with multiple levels of people at various times.  It took four months and I understand that was "rushed". I interviewed with five people and was asked about working with difficult people.  I also was asked about having an MBA or CMA.
Interview Questions: Can you work with difficult people?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief meeting with then-supervisor and lead tech consultant.  Talked for about 30 minutes, mostly technical questions that were not difficult.  Pleasant but boring and boilerplate.  I don't really have much to say but this site is requiring me to describe the process.
Interview Questions: What is DHCP?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I got the opportunity by making a relationship with one of my teachers. She asked if I wanted to help with research for credits and I complied. The interview required speaking with several members of the psychology department and after being hired I had to be cleared for different requirements.
Interview Questions: What can you do for this school?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, second Phone with hiring manager, meeting with supervisor
Interview Questions: Describe how you would handle (example of project ) this project, providing as much detail as possible.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh
Interview Descriptions: Applied online
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview was very rigorous , onsite was relatively easy. behavioral questions mainly
Interview Questions: why do you want to leave your current job

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Little to no interview, it was based mostly on referral. They also had an online application where you'd come in and they'd give you a brief run down on exactly what they do.
Interview Questions: Didn't ask any questions they just showed you exactly what they do. When you're done they ask if you still want to work there .

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met research PI during an informational session and talked with him about his research and finally asked if he had any positions available.  Emailed back and forth about the details.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research?  How will it help you with your future goals?  Will you be able to make a serious time commitment?

title: Administrator I Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I got a call from the office for an interview about two weeks after submitting my application. The interviewer is their Executive Director. The questions are mostly about details of my background and experience. The interviewer at the same time tried to sell their department and benefits. This first interview went very well, and we talked around one and a half hours!

However, in the second round, the interviewer (a different one) indicated that she wanted someone with more experience, even though "1-2 years experience" and "Baccalaureate" was what they required on the job post. My master's degree and over 2 years experience was not enough for them any more. So I didn't get an offer.
Interview Questions: Very typical questions. Just be yourself and be honest.

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted on time, in a quiet environment. My interviewer was cordial, friendly, informative, and eager to answer my questions. I was given preliminarily assessments on my skills, which were evaluated on site while I waited. I was informed of my results, and hired on the apt to start in two days.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Web Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
First is a phone interview, they asked what skills do I have and described the job.
Then I came to the office, they showed me the website and expectation about the website. And asked me if I can do that.
Interview Questions: All the question are basic, no difficult and unexpected question.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The first phone interview is just between me and my postdoc supervisor. We went over my resume together, and she asked me some technical questions, which went pretty well and then I talked to different lab members such as MS or Ph.D. candidates, lab tech, and the lab manager one by one and they were very nice and friendly, and just ask some very easy question. A couple of weeks later, I got the offer!
Interview Questions: technical experience

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submission of a job application and provision of references. There was no sit-down interview; rather, I received a receipt of the submission of my application and a few months later I received an email asking if I was still interested in the position. I was not able to designate which times I would be available to lead recitations, but I was invited to select my own office hours.
Interview Questions: Do you still want this job? You must be willing to work at these times:

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: You need to describe some concepts in English. They want to examine your ability of oral English, understanding of concepts, and communication skill. Also, you need to behave as a teacher, although interviewers are all professors.
Interview Questions: how to explain 5 number summary

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had my Ph.D. adviser an interview about your BS/MS research experience. I also talked about the future development of this specific materials. After that, He gave me a tour about his research equipment and the lab. It is better to prepare three to five questions in order to show your desire to join his group.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join my lab?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Usually the university advertises the post-doc jobs on their website. You can apply to the individual faculty and someone emails you to set-up an interview with the faculty. Faculties usually ask about previous work experience, kind of work one did, kind of expertise one has. Sometimes they give few papers to understand the future work and calls for a 2nd interview to listen about new ideas after reading the papers
Interview Questions: Coming up with some new idea of work after reading few papers is some times difficult

title: Research Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took forever but once you get an interview it kind of goes fast.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions. Everything was stated correctly in the job description

title: GSR Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Sent emails to a couple of Professors talking about my background and how I am a good fit for their research group. Skype Interview with a Professor. Described topics of research. Asked about my background and experiences. Asked about the papers I have published. Asked about preferred type of funding GSR/TA.
Interview Questions: How do i fit their research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Setting up a meeting with a prospective professor. Application process and follow-up. Acceptance. Application for funding. Final terms
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in working on this project? (when you know little about the subject)

title: Telecaller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: After the online application, there was a 1:1 interview which was followed by the employer giving me a script. I was supposed to go home, prepare the script and then call him back as a prospective customer four or five days later at a specified time. Based on both the interviews a choice was made to hire or not to hire
Interview Questions: What do you think should be the mission ?

title: Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a phone screening about academic and experiential background.  Then had a multiple panel interview with key people from across the Student Affair department.  Later had a 1-1 interview with a Dean.  The people seemed really friendly and seemed very interested in getting to know me.  They clearly wanted to hire a qualified candidate but didn't make the interview intimidating.
Interview Questions: What would this program look like in 5 years if it was really successful?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on phone. Talked to a professor, he informed me about the city and facilities. He asked me what my research interests are. He told me what are the current research work at PITT, how i can use it to my benefit.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: half an hour telephone interview called by the PI, and then samples of SAS program were requested and reviewed. I got the admission in the PHD program in 2010, but got funding for the PHD study one year later
Interview Questions: average difficulty

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very nice introduction to coursework and research options! At least for my department/program we were given a nice tour of the campuses (Pitt/CMU) and given suggestions for where to live. We also were given introductions to current students so we could ask what the PhD program was like.
Interview Questions: What kind of mathematical/statistical/physics background do you have?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Since I knew someone who worked there, I was able to meet the Dept. Head for a 1:1. Unfortunately he didnt have a position at the time but got back to me once he had a position.
Interview Questions: Describe your dissertation research to a lay person.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed directly with the Principle Investigator I would later work with. She was laid back and welcoming. Later, she championed for me through HR for raises and promotions. She taught me so much and was truly the best boss I ever had.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge you have faced and how you overcame that challenge.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview after phd application, get two phone screens, the first one is conducted by the department head, and second one is by my current advisor. The interview is very basic, not technical questions, just ask about my undergraduate work, what is the plan after phd etc.
Interview Questions: What is your plan after phd? Why you want to have a phd? Why choose this department?

title: Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: We have to apply for the internship with letters of recommendation, statement of purpose and curriculum vitae at their website. Then they select the candidate and contact him/ her through email. They ask the candidate to send the needed documents like copy of passport and a few other documents (like bank account statement, copy of health insurance etc.), following which the visa processing begins, and the university sends required documents to the candidate through mail/ shipping. After that, the candidate can apply for the visa and if approved, goes off to work in the US for the required length of time.
Interview Questions: not applicable

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I replied to an email and went in to interview within the same week. The interview was less than 15 min., it was for an internship position.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in entreprenurialship?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty good, just general questions.The interviewer was only my boss, it was very relaxed. We chatted like friends, not seemed that I was looking for a job, and my boss was very nice.
Interview Questions: where did you get your education, what have you done during the past several years?

title: Research Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two different departments both of which had similar expectations, interview questions, and requirements.  Questions were relatively standard. My best advice is to add something personal to the question/answer portion of the interview that will make the interviewer remember you and help you stand out from the applicant pool.
Interview Questions: Specifics on experimental techniques that I had no previous experience with.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I just got call for an interview from my boss, while I was a visiting student from abroad.
He offered me the position.
Interview Questions: For me was easy

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was asked about past research experience and future interest
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Programmer IV Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to interview for a senior position. Checked back with them. They had not made up their mind either about me or about the position. Said they were thinking of downgrading the position to a lower classification and salary. Strange because during the interview they had complained about junior level staff who didn't know what they were doing and quit after a few months.
Interview Questions: What salary are you looking for?

title: Secretary III - Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Manager called me and invited me for an interview. At the interview, the manager expressed concern over the hiring range (being much lower than what I was making at my previous employer). It was my impression that their is not much room for negotiation and the manager is not given discretion to make a higher offer. After a week I was offered the job at a slightly higher number and the manager stated this was the best they could do. I believed them and accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Can you carry out a work assignment that you morally disagree with the subject matter of?

title: Master Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the tutor coordinator and she told me to come in to fill out an application.  After I filled out the application we scheduled an interview.  In the interview, she checked to make sure my overall GPA was acceptable and that my grades in the classes I was going to tutor were good enough.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Springfield, MA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Discussed my goals as a student and why I would fit the position. Went over the responsibilities of the position and the expectations of the employee.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I contacted a professor in the department that I was interested in. I sent him my CV and transcript, exchanged some emails addressing some questions that the professor had, and in less than a week I got an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do a PhD being so young?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line.  I was called by HR for a phone interview.  I was brought on site for a group interview and then went through a series of 1 on 1 interviews with the Assistant Dean and Dean.  An offer was made shortly after.  The entire process was under 2 months.
Interview Questions: There were traditional interview questions.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: initial communication by email, followed by requests for recommendation letters and finally an invitation to visit, give a talk at the department and meetings with faculty members.
Interview Questions: none

title: Coordinator of Ticket Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by phone to conduct an informal phone interview (take this very seriously and be prepared for the call), the I came in for a face to face interview with my would be supervisor, his supervisor, and someone else from the department individually.  Then I came in for another face interview with the top two ranking employees of the department and the business manager.   The process always takes longer than they say it will.
Interview Questions: They gave me a situation of an upset customer and asked how I would handle the situation.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: I applied in May, got a call in 2 weeks for an interview, went to the first interview which was pretty lax and met with my direct supervisor.  Nothing unnerving was asked it was more of a meet and greet.  Two weeks later I get a call to come in for another interview in 2 more weeks.  I got in and meet with the main manager(who worked a whole 3 days a week) and the director of housing.  This was a much more awkward interview.  I don't recall very many of the questions but I remember being really unsettled afterward.  Got a call back two weeks later saying they were still trying to figure things out and to just hold out.  Two weeks later I was hired and my start date would be, you guessed it, in two weeks.  Longest hiring process ever!!!
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy in regard to customer service?
